results.title: The Laws of motion
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Uses laboratory demonstrations and experiments to demonstrate elastic collisions, the principle of conservation of momentum, Newton’s second law of motion, constant force and constant acceleration and the law of falling bodies.

results.title: Radioactivity
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Looks at the ionization of air, the diffusion cloud chamber, and radioactive decay and provides demonstrations to clarify the properties of radioactive particles not readily observed in laboratories. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Electrostatics II
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Deals with electromagnetic induction, a single turn generator, modern large power stations, the transmission of electricity, currents in electrical equipment, ring mains, electromagnetic damping and forces on conductors. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Electrostatics I
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Deals with Coulombic attraction and repulsion, Perrin’s tube, the charge on electrons, electrostatic charges on carpets, xerography, electrostatic precipitation, electrostatic charge on liquids, electrostatic generators, lightning conductors and capacitors. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Electromagnetic spectrum
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Provides demonstrations of ultra-violet and infra-red radiation, radio waves and microwaves and shows the application of reflection of light in medical technology particularly X-ray machines, broadcasting and microwave ovens. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Australia at work
results.creator_credit: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Focus Audio-Visual Services and Appleseed Productions
results.brief_description: This series of four videos has been compiled from extensive footage of the working environment. Hundreds of Australians from all walks of life have been interviewed to paint a fascinating picture of the Australian working community.

results.title: Australia: a fair and reasonable community?
results.creator_credit: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Focus Audio-Visual Services and Appleseed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Australia at work”.
A four part series examining Australians’ attitudes to work and to changes in the Australian workplace. This episode examines wealth and the distribution of wealth in Australian society. Though considered a fair and equitable society, the video introduces us to the people who are not involved in “wealth production”: the unemployed. An examination is made of the social welfare system in Australia and the importance of the Trade Union movement in fighting for the rights and for the safety of organised labour.

results.title: Australia's people and patterns of work
results.creator_credit: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Focus Ausio-Visual Services and Appleseed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Australia at work”.
A four part series examining Australians’ attitudes to work and to changes in the Australian workplace. The first part of this episode examines the history of industry and labour in Australia, as well as looking at the current diversity of occupations and work throughout the country. Australians involved in unpaid labour are interviewed, particularly women working in domestic labour. The second half of the video examines the difficulties and discrimination encountered by women, migrants, Aborigines and the disabled in the labour market.

results.title: Work: a window on Australian society
results.creator_credit: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Focus Audio-Visual Services and Appleseed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australia at work”.
A four part series examining Australians’ attitudes to work and to changes in the Australian workplace. This first episode introduces some key concepts in any discussion of work: labour, division of labour, industry, and industrial relations. Through interviews with a wide cross-section of people the video examines what is meant by work and the work ethic, and examines how people define themselves through work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Focus Audio-Visual Services and Appleseed Productions

results.title: Australia: a technological society?
results.creator_credit: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Focus Audio-Visual Services and Appleseed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia at work”.
A four part series examining Australians’ attitudes to work and to changes in the Australian workplace. This final episode examines the increasing impact of technology throughout all Australian industry. Increases in productivity are linked to the growing mechanisation of industries and a resultant change to traditional work practices. As a direct result of increased mechanisation, workers now need to retrain and be educated in using new technologies. Through interviews with employees and management the impact of technology on working life is discussed, as well as the effects technology will have on Australian society in the future.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Focus Audio-Visual Services and Appleseed Productions
